availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jonathan Butler (Butler County, Kentucky, tavern keeper and Justice of the Peace)

body.p: Butler County, Kentucky, tavern keeper and justice of the peace. Indiana native. Son of Abel Butler and Mildren Butler. Married to Erinda A. Rone Butler in Warren County, Kentucky, on September 24, 1855. Father to James Leonidas Butler. Farmer in Perry County, Indiana, in 1850. Tavern keeper in Morgantown, Kentucky, in 1860. Appointed justice of the peace in District 1 in Butler County in 1862. Distiller in Butler County in 1863. Died in Butler County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Perry County, Troy Township, p. 366B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Butler County, Morgantown, p. 1006.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film #000339890, p. 29.

Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Butler County Administration Bonds, 1830-1869; Vol 19-20, 1970-1975, p. 327.
